cs.CR, cs.PL, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.LO. 

The paper deals with information flow security in a distributed setting, which is a topic that falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes enforcement mechanisms based on type and effect systems, which is a topic that falls under programming languages (cs.PL). The paper deals with concurrent threads and code migration, which is a topic that falls under distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses refining security properties, which is a topic that falls under software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper deals with ensuring that information flows respect the allowed flow policy of the domains where they originate, which is a topic that falls under logic in computer science (cs.LO).
